title: Nintendo 3DS prices skyrocket up to 76% — vintage Nintendo console rivals the cost of a brand new Switch 2
summary: Vintage Nintendo 3DS gaming handhelds are soaring in price, with the XL version selling for between $200 and $350 on eBay.

title: AMD's Ryzen 7 9850X3D tipped for modest price hike — early listings point to $500 list for refreshed Zen 5 CPU
summary: A new tip suggests the pricing of AMD's Ryzen 7 9850X3D will be close to the 9800X3D. Listings show a $511.4 ask for the new chip, but no official MSRP is mentioned. Running a few calculations gives us a value of around $499 as the supposed list price.

title: SoftBank stakes $4B on securing AI data center power and capacity — DigitalBridge purchase indicative of AI industry's increasing investments in energy supply
summary: SoftBank has agreed to acquire DigitalBridge in a deal valuing the digital infrastructure investor at roughly $4 billion, including debt.

title: 'He's gone!' - Robinson scores 93-yard touchdown
summary: Bijan Robinson runs in a 93-yard touchdown as the Atlanta Falcons beat the Los Angeles Rams 27-24.

title: Chinese firms Bytedance and Tencent reportedly offer massive 150% pay increases and 35% bonuses to entice AI talent — salaries and increases also expected to balloon in 2026
summary: Tech companies are spending more on AI-focused employees even as the rest of the industry is laying off hundreds of thousands.

title: MSI B850 MPower Motherboard Review: Micro ATX made for overclocking memory
summary: MSI’s B850 MPower is a solid all-around motherboard, but excels at memory overclocking, specifically with 8000-series APUs, where speeds over 10,000 MT/s are possible.

title: Another 16-pin GPU power connector gets scorched, but this time it's not an RTX 5090 — User finds their Sapphire Nitro+ 9070 XT with scorched pins
summary: The decisions to put a 16-pin power connector on a non-Nvidia GPU has started to show its consequences on the RX 9070 XT. Sapphire's Nitro+ variant uses a 12v-2x6 connector, which has burnt down thrice already, making this the fourth case so far, joining the first ASRock Taichi card that broke the …

title: NFL play-off picture - scenarios & big game deciders in season finale
summary: The final week of the NFL season is here with the final play-off spots, both top seedings and four division titles to be decided, with three huge head-to-head deciders.

title: China tells chipmakers to use homegrown chipmaking tools for 50% of new capacity — decree designed to squeeze foreign suppliers out of supply chain
summary: China has quietly mandated that at least 50% of equipment used for new semiconductor capacity be domestically sourced. However, as China's industry cannot produce enough lithography tools, authorities tend to get flexible and allow foreign alternatives in.

title: Open source project brings 53-year-old interface to USB — GPIB adapter v3 adds integrated Ethernet port with PoE
summary: An open source USB to GPIB adapter will soon reach version 3, bringing an integrated Ethernet port with PoE support.

title: Grab this 4K gaming PC with an RTX 5080 and 9800X3D for just $2,499 before prices skyrocket — $200 saving on powerful Skytech rig with 32GB of DDR5 RAM and 1TB SSD
summary: This $2,499 Skytech gaming PC is an elite-level rig for gaming at 4K, fitted with an Nvidia GeForce RTX 5080 and an AMD Ryzen 7 9800X3D, along with 32GB of DDR5 RAM and a 1TB SSD.

title: GOG acquired by co-founder, reiterates philosophy of ‘freedom, independence, and genuine control’ — CD Projekt sells platform to focus on creating games
summary: CD Projekt sells 100% of GOG to co-founder Michał Kiciński, allowing the company to focus on new games and upcoming titles under its existing franchises.

title: Start-up plans to use terahertz radio frequencies for communication between servers instead of copper or optical connections — radio-based interconnections offer 1.6 TB/s using half the volume of copper
summary: When copper is not enough and yet optical interconnections are overkill, waveguide-based cables can do the job.

title: Recovered Unix v4 tape quickly yields a usable operating system — nostalgia addicts can now boot up Unix v4 in a browser window
summary: Nostalgia addicts can now get their Unix v4 fix in a browser

title: ShaderBeam provides CRT-like motion clarity on high refresh rate LCD and OLED monitors — open-source project offers BFI emulation in any game
summary: Blur Busters has released an overlay that enables its CRT motion clarity emulator to run in Windows and PC games. Gamers can now enjoy the motion-blur-reduction effects of CRT emulation in PC titles.

title: How South Africa conquered Test cricket - but have 21-month wait for home match
summary: BBC Sport reflects on a stellar year for South Africa which threatens to be overshadowed by a lack of home Test cricket.

title: Builder customizes 3D-printed PC case with worthwhile upgrades — premium 3D printing template with magnetically attached panels boasts ease of use, customizability, and design flair
summary: A maker has shared their take on the Makeyo MK01 3D printed PC case, implementing several worthwhile mods.

title: Kyrgios defeats Sabalenka - but what did 'Battle of the Sexes' achieve?
summary: Aryna Sabalenka loses to Nick Kyrgios in a Battle of the Sexes-style match that lacked the intensity and entertainment promised in the build-up.

title: Take on our BBC Gameshows ultimate football quiz
summary: We've built five quizzes to celebrate five BBC shows - but only those with the biggest football trivia brains can beat them all.

title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.

title: What next for friendly foes who see each other 'more than family'?
summary: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz have dominated men’s tennis in 2025. BBC Sport looks at the evolution of their growing rivalry – and where it could go next.
